## The essential ingredients (functions) to a plot

.pull-left[`library(ggplot2)` - equivalent of `import seaborn`

`ggplot()` - primary plotting function

`geom_*()` - provides choice of geometry

`aes()` - adding aesthetics]

.pull-right[

name: The penguins data
class: top, center

## The penguins

```{r echo=FALSE}
penguins %>%
  kable()%>%
  kable_styling()%>%
  scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px")
```

---
name: step by step graph
class: top, left

```{r layers1, include=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins)+
  aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
      y = bill_depth_mm)+
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5)
```

`r chunk_reveal(chunk_name = "layers1", title = "Layer by Layer")`

.small[alpha is used to set transparency of geoms]

---

name: placing aes
class: top, left

```{r layers2, include=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins)+
  geom_point(aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
      y = bill_depth_mm, colour = species),
      alpha = 0.5)
```

`r chunk_reveal(chunk_name = "layers2", title = "The right 'Aesthetics'")`

.small[aesthetics can be mapped to a variable in data or can be defined independently]
---

name: lab and theme
class: top, left

```{r layers3, include=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins)+
  geom_point(aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
      y = bill_depth_mm, colour = species),
      alpha = 0.5)+
  labs(
    x = "Bill length (mm)",
    y = "Bill depth (mm)",
    title = "Bill length vs Bill depth",
    caption = "colours of points are linked to species"
  )+
  theme(
    panel.background = element_blank(),
    panel.grid = element_line(colour = "grey")
  )
```

`r chunk_reveal(chunk_name = "layers3", title = "A little more pretty")`

.small[The labs and theme functions will help you make changes to default appearances of a plot]
